DataElement.preferredDefinition: A set of statements describing a group of facts that clarifies the cause, context and/or consequence for the packaging and shipping submission condition(s) of a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Tracking Packing And Shipping Submission Condition Explanation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The act or process of following a person, animal, or object through space or time._Performance of the packaging part of the manufacturing process._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The act or business of transporting goods._The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something._A state of being, such as a state of health._A set of statements describing a group of facts that clarifies the cause, context and/or consequence of those facts.

Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
The act or process of following a person, animal, or object through space or time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.: To take, accept, or get something offered.: The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.: Caused by or resulting from.: The state of the atmosphere at a given time and place, with respect to variables such as temperature, moisture, wind velocity, and barometric pressure.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. To take, accept, or get something offered.
The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase when the temperature is lowered.
Caused by or resulting from.
The state of the atmosphere at a given time and place, with respect to variables such as temperature, moisture, wind velocity, and barometric pressure.
